meanings.definition: In a clumsy or awkward manner
meanings.sent1: He walked lumpishly across the room, bumping into furniture along the way.
meanings.sent2: She danced lumpishly at the party, tripping over her own feet.
meanings.sent3: The clown juggled lumpishly, causing laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The robot moved lumpishly, as if its circuits were malfunctioning.
meanings.sent5: The toddler tried to run lumpishly, resembling a wobbly penguin.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of grace or agility
meanings.sent1: The lumpishly movements of the bear startled the hikers in the forest.
meanings.sent2: Her lumpishly attempts at ballet made the audience cringe.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to be lumpishly elegant, but ended up knocking over a vase.
meanings.sent4: The old car moved lumpishly down the road, its engine struggling.
meanings.sent5: The giant robot moved lumpishly through the city, causing chaos wherever it went.
